Interface FluidSolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
ObjectFluidSolver, PrimitiveFluidSolver
public interface FluidSolver
Interface for Fluid Dynamics Solvers. Allows comparison between different implementation strategies (e.g. Primitive vs Object).
Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addForce(double x, double y, double dx, double dy)
    Adds an external force (e.g. mouse interaction).
    double[]
    getFlowAt(double x, double y)
    Gets the flow vector at a precise coordinate.
    String
    getName()
    Returns the name of the solver implementation.
    void
    initialize(int size, int scale)
    Initializes the solver grid.
    void
    step(double speed, double viscosity, double zOff)
    Solves one time step.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      void initialize(int size, int scale)
      Initializes the solver grid.
      Parameters:
      size - Grid size (N)
      scale - Grid scale

    • step

      void step(double speed, double viscosity, double zOff)
      Solves one time step.
      Parameters:
      speed - Simulation speed factor
      viscosity - Fluid viscosity
      zOff - Noise offset for generation

    • getFlowAt

      double[] getFlowAt(double x, double y)
      Gets the flow vector at a precise coordinate.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate (pixels)
      y - Y coordinate (pixels)
      Returns:
      double[2] {vx, vy}

    • addForce

      void addForce(double x, double y, double dx, double dy)
      Adds an external force (e.g. mouse interaction).
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
      dx - Force X component
      dy - Force Y component

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name of the solver implementation.
